Jada Pinkett Smith has revealed that she and husband Will Smith have been separated for the last seven years.

The Girls Trip star, 52, shared in a new interview with People published on 11 October that she and the King Richard actor, 55, are ‚Äústill figuring it out‚Äù when it comes to their marriage of 26 years. She explained at the time of the 2022 Academy Awards, when Will slapped Chris Rock, they had been separated for six years.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been doing some really heavy-duty work together,‚Äù Jada said. ‚ÄúWe just got deep love for each other and we are going to figure out what that looks like for us.‚Äù

The pair have been married since 1997 and share son Jaden, 25, and daughter Willow, 22. The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air star also has a son Trey, 30, whom he shares with his first wife, Sheree Zampino.

As for her children, Jada praised them for how they‚Äôve helped her grow. ‚ÄúMy children, they‚Äôre little gurus. They‚Äôve taught me a deep sense of self-acceptance,‚Äù she told the outlet.

Jada and Will have often opened up about their relationship over the years, and have had very public ups and downs throughout their marriage. Here‚Äôs a timeline of their relationship.

1994: Will and Jada meet on the set of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air

Will and Jada met after she auditioned for the role of Will‚Äôs girlfriend on The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air. While she did not get the part, the pair hit it off - despite Will being married to Sheree Zampino at the time, with who he shares son Trey.

‚ÄúI had a realisation I wasn‚Äôt with the person I was supposed to be with,‚Äù he told Jada‚Äôs Red Table Talk in 2018. ‚ÄúI was sitting in a [bathroom] stall and I was crying and laughing uncontrollably, and I knew [Jada] was the woman I was supposed to be with.‚Äù

Will and Jada in 2000 (Getty)

1995: The pair officially begin dating

It wasn‚Äôt until 1995 that Will and Jada began seriously dating after Will finalised his divorce from Zampino.

1997: Will and Jada get engaged and married

Will popped the question to Jada in November 1997 before getting married just one month later in Baltimore.

Jada wasn‚Äôt initially sold on the idea of marriage. She told People in 2019: ‚ÄúI never wanted to get married. But my mother was like: ‚ÄòYou have to get married‚Äô - she‚Äôs so old-school - and Will wanted a family. So I said: ‚ÄòAll right, maybe it‚Äôs something I should do.‚Äô‚Äù

1998: Their first child is born

Jada and Will‚Äôs first child together, son Jayden, was born in July 1998.

2000: Their second child was born

Jada and Will welcomed daughter Willow in 2000.

Will and Jada with their son Jayden in 2003 (Getty)

2013: Jada denies open marriage rumours (sort of)

After a quiet decade and a half making movies and raising their children, Jada took to Facebook to address rumours she and Will were in an open relationship.

She wrote: ‚ÄúHere is how I will change my statement... Will and I BOTH can do WHATEVER we want, because we TRUST each other to do so. This does NOT mean we have an open relationship... this means we have a GROWN one.‚Äù

2015: Will addresses divorce rumours

Will addresses persistent separation rumours by clarifying the pair were not getting a divorce.

‚ÄúUnder normal circumstances, I don‚Äôt usually respond to foolishness. But, so many people have extended [to] me their ‚Äòdeepest condolences‚Äô that I figured - ‚ÄòWhat the hell‚Ä¶ I can be foolish, too!‚Äô‚Äù he wrote on Facebook at the time. ‚ÄúSo, in the interest of redundant, repetitious, over and over-again-ness‚Ä¶ Jada and I are‚Ä¶ NOT GETTING A DIVORCE!!!!!!!!!!!!!‚Äù

2018: Will revealed that he and Jada don‚Äôt refer to themselves as married

In an episode of TIDAL‚Äôs Rap Radar podcast, Will said he and Jada ‚Äúrefer to ourselves as life partners, where you get into that space where you realise you are literally with somebody for the rest of your life. There‚Äôs no deal breakers. There‚Äôs nothing she could do - ever. Nothing that would break our relationship. She has my support till death and it feels so good to get to that space.‚Äù

2020: August Alsina claims he had an affair with Jada

August Alsina and Jada were introduced in 2015, but it wasn‚Äôt until 2020 that he claimed that he and Jada had dated while she was married and that her and Will‚Äôs marriage was open during that time.

Alsina said Will gave him and Jada his ‚Äúblessing‚Äù, adding: ‚ÄúI actually sat down with Will and had a conversation due to the transformation from their marriage to life partnership that they‚Äôve spoken on several times and it not involving romanticism.‚Äù

Alsina added he ‚Äútotally gave myself to that relationship for years of my life and I truly and really, really deeply loved and have a ton of love for her.‚Äù

The same day Alsina‚Äôs claims surfaced Jada‚Äôs reps said they were ‚Äúabsolutely not true‚Äù.

Less than two weeks later, Jada and Will appeared on an episode of Jada‚Äôs Red Table Talk where Jada confirmed that she did have a relationship with Alsina, saying that she and Will were separated at the time.

‚ÄúWe decided that we were going to separate for a period of time and you go figure out how to make yourself happy and I‚Äôll figure out how to make myself happy,‚Äù Jada said at the time.

‚ÄúFrom there, as time went on, I got into a different kind of entanglement with August... Yes, it was a relationship absolutely.‚Äù

Jada also said that Will didn‚Äôt give permission, as the only person who could give her permission was herself.

2021: Jada discusses her and Will‚Äôs sex life, Will‚Äôs memoir is released

In another episode of Red Table Talk in October 2021, Jada said it ‚Äútakes work‚Äù to maintain a spark in the bedroom.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard... the thing Will and I talk about a lot is the journey. We started in this [relationship] at a very young age, 22 years old... I think you expect your partner to know - especially when it comes to sex. It‚Äôs like: ‚ÄòWell, if you love me, you should know. If you love me, you should read my mind.‚Äô That‚Äôs a huge pitfall,‚Äù she said at the time.

The next month, Will‚Äôs memoir is released which details several issues the couple have had over the years. He wrote they were ‚Äúsuffering the brutal death of our romantic fantasies, the burning away of the idealistic illusion of the perfect marriage and the perfect family. Neither of us wanted a divorce; we knew we loved each other, and some aspects of our union were magical. But the structure of the life that we had established was strangling both of us.‚Äù

2022: No infidelity statement and Oscars incident

During an interview on CBS Sunday Morning earlier this month, Will said he and Jada had never accused each other of cheating.

He said: ‚ÄúNever. There‚Äôs never been infidelity in our marriage...And we have never surprised one another with anything ever..I have decided that chatter about my life can be of a benefit to people. I think that chatter is the first stage to having a real conversation and being able to truly explore if some of the things in your heart are loving, or poisonous.‚Äù

In March 2022, Will slapped Chris Rock at the 94th annual Oscars before he yelled at the comedian to ‚Äúkeep my wife‚Äôs name out your f***ing mouth‚Äù. It quickly became the most talked-about moment of the evening with the pair initially appearing to laugh off the tense moment.

The altercation came after Rock said: ‚ÄúJada, I love you. GI Jane 2, can‚Äôt wait to see you,‚Äù referring to Jada‚Äôs shaved head. While accepting the award for Best Actor, Will became teary as said he was a ‚Äúfierce defender of his family‚Äù.
title: A timeline of Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith‚Äôs relationship amid separation

Fans have spotted Travis Kelce wearing a friendship bracelet with Taylor Swift lyrics on it, just days before she attended his Kansas City Chiefs game.

In a video posted to TikTok on 25 September, a fan shared a photo of Kelce posing with the piece of jewellery on his wrist. The post came after Swift was seen enthusiastically cheering him on in the box seats at Arrowhead Stadium, fuelling speculation that she and the athlete are dating.

The now-viral photo shows how Kelce may have hinted at the ongoing dating rumours before Swift attended his game. The snap showed Kelce posing at the Kelce Car Jam charity event on Friday 22 September, where he was sporting a beaded friendship bracelet that read: ‚ÄúVigilante S***‚Äù

The beads on the friendship bracelet appeared to reference Swift‚Äôs song ‚ÄúVigilante S***‚Äù from her 2022 album, Midnights. In addition to the Swiftie-themed jewellery, Kelce also wore a white striped shirt with silver chain necklaces, black sunglasses, and black pants for the event.

In the comments, fans both praised and questioned Kelce for the beaded friendship bracelet. Many people also pointed out how fans of the ‚ÄúBad Blood‚Äù singer famously trade and wear friendship bracelets at Swift‚Äôs Eras Tour concerts.

‚ÄúOF ALL 230 SONGS IN THE DISCOGRAPHY I‚ÄôM SICK,‚Äù one fan commented, while another person wrote: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs unbelievable how invested I am in this.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna need to go back and see all photos of him from the last three months and dissect if he‚Äôs wearing friendship bracelets,‚Äù a third wrote.

In other photos from the charity event - which were shared to Instagram by Jordan‚Äôs KC photography - Kelce wasn‚Äôt seen wearing the friendship bracelet, leading many people to believe that he received the bracelet from a fan that day.

Two days after his charity event, the ‚ÄúAll Too Well‚Äù singer was spotted cheering for the Kansas City Chiefs tight end from the box seats at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri. Not only was she seen sitting next to Kelce‚Äôs mother, Donna, but she also appeared to yell ‚Äúlet‚Äôs f***ing go‚Äù in response to Kelce‚Äôs third-quarter touchdown reception.

After the game, which saw the Chiefs beat the Chicago Bears 41-10, Kelce was seen leaving the stadium in a blue and white splatter-paint denim suit. Eagle-eyed fans were quick to believe that Kelce‚Äôs outfit paid homage to Swift‚Äôs forthcoming album, 1989 (Taylor‚Äôs Version), which is due for re-release on 27 October.

After the two escaped the crowd at Arrowhead Stadium in Kelce‚Äôs convertible, according to photos and videos posted online, the football star reportedly rented out Prime Social Rooftop in Kansas City for a post-game celebration with his family, his teammates, and Swift.

‚ÄúTravis bought out the restaurant for his family and team. Taylor arrived, wearing a denim dress, and was seen snacking, having some cocktails and dancing alongside Travis,‚Äù the witness told Entertainment Tonight. ‚ÄúThe two were very affectionate with one another but kept things fun and lighthearted. Travis‚Äô teammates also showed up to the after-party, as well as his mom, Donna Kelce. The party lasted until 2 am.‚Äù

The late-night outing came days after the NFL star officially addressed ongoing dating rumours about him and the ‚ÄúAnti-Hero‚Äù singer. During an episode of The Pat McAfee Show on 21 September, he mocked his brother Jason Kelce for joking that he ‚Äú100 per cent‚Äù believed his younger sibling was dating Swift.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hilarious how much traction this has actually gotten, right now it‚Äôs like a game of telephone,‚Äù Kelce said. ‚ÄúWhere everybody‚Äôs whispering in each other‚Äôs ears and hearing random stuff. No one actually knows what‚Äôs going on, especially when you got Jason Kelce on live television telling people just both sides - he doesn‚Äôt know, it‚Äôs true, this and that.‚Äù

He also noted that he was still open to pursuing a relationship with Swift, revealing that he subtly asked if she‚Äôd want to attend one of his football games.

‚ÄúI threw it out there, I threw the ball in her court,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI told her, you know, I‚Äôve seen you rock the stage in Arrowhead [Stadium], you might have to come see me rock the stage in Arrowhead and see which one‚Äôs a little more lit. So, we‚Äôll see what happens in the near future.‚Äù

Back in July, Kelce first confessed that he tried - and failed - to give Swift his number by giving her a friendship bracelet at one of her Eras Tour concerts. ‚ÄúI was disappointed that she doesn‚Äôt talk before or after her shows, because she has to save her voice for the 44 songs that she sings,‚Äù he explained to his brother on their podcast.

‚ÄúSo I was a little butthurt I didn‚Äôt get to hand her one of the bracelets I made for her,‚Äù Kelce said. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre up on Taylor Swift concerts, there are friendship bracelets and I received a bunch of them being there, but I wanted to give Taylor Swift one with my number on it.‚Äù
title: Fans spot Travis Kelce wearing Taylor Swift-themed friendship bracelet before she attended his game

Longtime Hollywood couple Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith sent shockwaves around the world this week when the Red Table Talk host revealed that she and the actor have been separated since 2016. Both Jada and Will have previously doubled down on their stance against getting a divorce, but her recent reveal about their lengthy separation poses a new question: When should couples just get a divorce?

In an interview with People on 10 October, Jada shared that during the 2022 Academy Awards - when Will slapped Chris Rock after he cracked a joke about Jada‚Äôs appearance - the pair had actually been separated for six years. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been doing some really heavy-duty work together,‚Äù she explained, while promoting her new memoir, Worthy. ‚ÄúWe just got deep love for each other and we are going to figure out what that looks like for us.‚Äù

She praised her and Will‚Äôs two children - Jaden, 25, and Willow, 22 - for being her ‚Äúlittle gurus‚Äù throughout this time, noting that they‚Äôve taught her ‚Äúa deep sense of self-acceptance‚Äù. Although the married couple are not living together, she insisted that their marriage has never been an open one, as she and Will have ‚Äúeliminated the chance of betrayal‚Äù while going on to live their ‚Äúseparate lives‚Äù.

This isn‚Äôt the first time that Jada and Will have taken some time apart from each other. During a 2020 episode of her Facebook Watch series, Red Table Talk, Jada disclosed that while she and Will were separated amicably, she had a relationship with singer August Alsina, describing their involvement as an ‚Äúentanglement‚Äù.

Throughout their marriage of 26 years, the A-listers have made it clear that divorce was never in the cards. Jada furthered that belief during a preview for an interview with Today‚Äôs Hoda Kotb, which aired on 13 October. ‚ÄúI made a promise that there will never be a reason for us to get a divorce,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe will work through, whatever. I just haven‚Äôt been able to break that promise.‚Äù

Of course, outsiders aren‚Äôt fully aware of the ‚Äúheavy-duty work‚Äù that Jada and Will have done throughout their marriage. But the amount of time they‚Äôve spent separated begs questions about all long-term relationships in general. When is it the time for couples to throw the towel in? And when should separations ultimately become the end result that couples have tried to avoid: divorce.

While there‚Äôs never a simple answer to the question, relationship experts have discovered the signs that it‚Äôs time to keep fighting for the one you love, or time to let them go.

Speaking to The Independent, New York City-based relationship expert Susan Winter highlighted the jarring differences between a separation and divorce. When it comes to divorce, Hollywood couples can notably get involved in lengthy legal processes, from dividing financial assets to creating child custody agreements. Although we don‚Äôt know the terms of Jada and Will‚Äôs separation, Winter believes that they‚Äôre showcasing a non-conventional relationship that‚Äôs not familiar to the public. Will and Jada‚Äôs dynamic includes living in separate homes, but it could be a choice that‚Äôs for the better.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an LAT partnership, meaning ‚Äòliving apart together,‚Äô‚Äù Winter said. ‚ÄúWhile everybody is at a different point as to why they are doing this, the centre point is the same: the preservation of the partnership is paramount. Separations can also be beneficial if both individuals are working on themselves and have the mutual goal of reuniting, or making their relationship better. However, that doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean that their improved relationship will result in them living together again.‚Äù

On the other hand, dating coach Jacob Lucas - who‚Äôs based in the UK - acknowledged that not all separations end in resolutions. When couples opt not to live together anymore, it could create an emotional disconnect between them. If a lack of connection occurred before couples separated, that separation doesn‚Äôt necessarily make the issues go away. In fact, Lucas believes that in these situations, couples could also be avoiding the inevitable breakup for the sake of comfortability.

(AFP via Getty Images)

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre not resolving their problems, they‚Äôre rescheduling them. So, if you separate from someone, but you live in a separate house and you‚Äôre still together, it seems to me you‚Äôre just not letting go of the past because you want to stick to what‚Äôs familiar,‚Äù he claimed. ‚ÄúPeople stick to what they know, and it‚Äôs like you have a tether to that person. Your brain‚Äôs like: ‚ÄòI cannot let go of them because I am scared of the unknown.‚Äô I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever seen a couple separate and come back again.‚Äù

It‚Äôs unclear whether Jada and Will plan on ending their separation and living in the same home again. However, the couple have been candid about their plans to not get a divorce. Jada previously recalled that when she first decided to get married to Will in 1997, it would be for the long haul. ‚ÄúI told Will from the gate, I said let me tell you something: ‚ÄòIf you marry me, know this: we‚Äôre gonna be together. We‚Äôre going to be under the same roof,‚Äô‚Äù she said during a 2018 episode of Red Table Talk. ‚ÄúFor me personally, I‚Äôm not mature enough to have a divorce, I‚Äôm just not. I don‚Äôt think I would ever be mature enough, I don‚Äôt.‚Äù

Will - who divorced his first wife, Sheree Zampino, in 1994 - has also shared similar sentiments about making his marriage with Jada work. Back in 2006, the Fresh Prince of Bel-Air star first explained to MTV News that divorce wasn‚Äôt an option for him and his second wife. ‚ÄúWith Jada, I stood up in front of God and said: ‚ÄòTil death do us part,‚Äô‚Äù he said at the time. ‚ÄúSo there are two possible outcomes. One, we are going to be together ‚Äòtil death, or two, I am dead.‚Äù

Speaking to The Independent, Lucas noted that while it‚Äôs important for both parties to be invested in their relationships, promising not to get a divorce could spark feelings of resentment down the line. Fans aren‚Äôt fully aware of why Will and Jada made that promise to each other, but the dating coach believes that an agreement like theirs could create a false narrative about a divorce.

Jada Pinkett Smith y Will Smith (Getty Images)

‚ÄúGetting divorced shouldn‚Äôt feel like a taboo because people grow apart and that‚Äôs fine,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúPeople get stuck in relationships because of their friends and family or societal pressure, and they worry about getting divorced. They think a divorce has a stigma to its name, which it doesn‚Äôt, and they push aside the fact that they still essentially feel trapped with someone they don‚Äôt want to be with.‚Äù

Perhaps one of the reasons why Jada and Will have promised not to get a divorce is because they also agreed not to sign a prenuptial agreement. In an interview with Parade published on 13 October, Jada explained it was her special connection with Will that encouraged them not to sign a prenup before getting married.

‚ÄúI feel that was a very real moment for the two of us to look each other in the eyes, recognise that there would be tough times in this journey and to say to each other: ‚ÄòNo matter what, we‚Äôre going to figure it out and that‚Äôs why we don‚Äôt need a prenup, because I‚Äôm making a promise that divorce won‚Äôt be necessary, that we will figure this out,‚Äô‚Äù she recalled. ‚ÄúAnd we made that promise to each other without all of the bridal wedding beauty; it was just sitting on a log in his mother‚Äôs backyard, and going: ‚ÄòHey‚Äô - having to really look at the possibility of us not being together.‚Äù

Although they‚Äôve made their dedication to each other quite clear, there have been some grey areas over the last seven years about the terms of Will and Jada‚Äôs separation. In 2020, Jada made headlines when she revealed in a Red Table Talk episode with her husband that she had a relationship with Alsina. She explained that she and her husband were ‚Äúseparated amicably‚Äù when the romance occurred, which had not been disclosed to the press at the time. ‚ÄúWe decided that we were going to separate for a period of time and you go figure out how to make yourself happy and I‚Äôll figure out how to make myself happy,‚Äù Jada said. As the Girls Trip star recalled that she ‚Äúgot into a different kind of entanglement with August,‚Äù she was prompted by Will to confirm it ‚Äúwas a relationship, absolutely.‚Äù

Outsiders are now aware that Jada and Will have been separated since 2016, but the timeline of her relationship with Alsina is still fuzzy. Indeed, the terms of Will and Jada‚Äôs separation are still unknown to the public and in some cases, having separate relationships can give couples the clarity they need about their marriage.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs pivotal here is, what was the agreement? Did we agree to separate to work on ourselves for the purpose of coming back together again?‚Äù Winter said. ‚ÄúDid we agree to separate and just be alone for a while and not have that discussion? And in the second case, if you have an affair, sometimes it can bring you back to the original person. You can get whatever you need to achieve or gain a different perspective, allowing you to decide if you want to come back or leave for good.‚Äù

Will Smith y Jada Pinkett Smith (Getty Images)

According to Lucas, some of the controversy surrounding Will and Jada‚Äôs relationship ties back to the 2022 Academy Awards - when the King Richard star jumped onto the stage and struck Rock across the face after the comedian made a joke about Jada‚Äôs shaved head, which is a result of her alopecia. ‚ÄúKeep my wife‚Äôs name out of your f***ing mouth,‚Äù Will yelled. Now that it‚Äôs been revealed the couple was separated at the time, Lucas questioned Will‚Äôs behaviour and word choice during the awards ceremony.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a weird reaction to have somebody who you‚Äôve been broken up with for six years, you know? So, were they really broken up or is Jada saying that as an attention-seeking thing?‚Äù he asked.

However, Winter still believes the controversial incident speaks different volumes about the work Will has put into his relationship. ‚ÄúI feel as though Will has a tremendous love and commitment to Jada, as well as to the marriage and the family unit,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThe pride that he takes in defending his wife is extraordinary, almost to the detriment of his image, at times.‚Äù

Ultimately, the public will never fully know what ‚Äúheavy-duty work‚Äù Will and Jada are doing in their relationship, and according to Winter, it‚Äôs not necessarily any of our business. Still, she believes that their choice to separate is something fluid and outside of the traditional marriage design - an evolving model that could also come to serve other couples. If Will and Jada have been spending seven years apart as a married couple, why would they decide to go back to living in the same household?

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre in the rough with a machete, carving a new path for themselves,‚Äù Winter said. ‚ÄúWhy would they say: ‚ÄòHey, let‚Äôs go back to the house and just relax?‚Äô They‚Äôre really exploring something vastly different. It doesn‚Äôt end up that you go back into that little box of ‚Äòthis is a marriage, we‚Äôre living together‚Äô. It just doesn‚Äôt do that.‚Äù

Every relationship is different, living in the public eye or not. Although living separately may not be an issue for some couples, there can still be some major signs that it‚Äôs time to leave a relationship behind. ‚ÄúWhen there is no stone left unturned, or when they have tried every single combination possible to make the relationship function and yet it doesn‚Äôt, that‚Äôs the time to pull the plug,‚Äù Winter added. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve done their individual work and they have done the work together and ended up in the same place.‚Äù

Will and Jada‚Äôs relationship could end in a variety of ways. The celebrity couple could stay separated, move back in together as a married pair, or they can get a divorce. However, there are still certain behaviours in a marriage that could signal it‚Äôs time to get a divorce.

‚ÄúIf you feel disrespected by your partner, feel humiliated, or were cheated on, you probably feel ready to split,‚Äù Lucas said. ‚ÄúI also think a real big one is, if you lose sexual attraction for your partner and you‚Äôve actively tried to get it back and can‚Äôt, it‚Äôs time to go.‚Äù
title: Jada Pinkett Smith and Will Smith have been separated since 2016 - when should couples just get divorced?

The first link between Swift and Kelce was established in 2016, when Kelce ‚Äì who helped bring his team to Super Bowl victory in both 2020 and 2023 ‚Äì played the classic game ‚ÄúKiss, Marry, Kill‚Äù. Speaking with AfterBuzz TV, Kelce was given the options of Swift, Katy Perry and Ariana Grande. He said he‚Äôd ultimately kill Grande, marry Perry and kiss Swift. That was about six years ago, but it has more recently set tongues wagging as fans wondered how long the plan for them to meet has been in the works. Cruel Summer Fast-forward seven years, and things started to heat up. In July, speaking on the podcast he shares with his brother, New Heights, Kelce said he intended to give Swift a friendship bracelet with his number on it during her Eras Tour concert in Kansas City. Unfortunately, the bracelet never made it to her wrist or his digits to her phone.

‚ÄúI was disappointed that she doesn‚Äôt talk before or after her shows because she has to save her voice for the 44 songs she sings,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt meet anybody, or at least she didn‚Äôt want to meet me, so I took it personal[sic].‚Äù At this point, it seems like any attraction between the two was one-sided. Kelce‚Äôs attempts to make proper contact with Swift at the show ultimately failed. Was she just not that into him? But Kelce, exhibiting the tenacity typical of a professional sportsman, remained determined to get her attention. Wildest Beards The Kelce brothers couldn‚Äôt stop talking about Swift, even though she‚Äôd left Travis hanging at the concert. Swift‚Äôs name began popping up everywhere on the podcast, including during conversations about... facial hair?

In August, the brothers discussed Kelce‚Äôs moustache, which he grows every year in honour of the Chief‚Äôs head coach, Andy Reid. When asked if he knew what Swift thought of the ‚Äôstache, he remained cheekily confident. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not going to bring up Taylor Swift in this episode,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúBut something tells me she‚Äôs going to like it.‚Äù There was a clear suggestion Kelce had made contact with Swift, and was even going to meet her. Shortly after that remark, Kelce took a week off training to visit New York City, according to Vulture. Coincidentally, this happened to be while Swift was re-recording her 1989 tracks in the city. Welcome to New York

The suspicion the two were actually spending time together in New York was seemingly confirmed in September when it was reported they had been ‚Äúquietly hanging out‚Äù for months. This was the first, albeit tentative, confirmation from the media rather than from amateur Swiftie sleuths on social media. So, it was only a matter of time before it entered the cultural zeitgeist. Blank Space Which it did, very quickly. On September 17, Kelce scored a touchdown against the Jaguars, triggering CBS announcer Ian Eagle to reference Swift‚Äôs 2014 hit, Blank Space.

‚ÄúKelce finds a blank space for the score,‚Äù Eagle said, poking fun at Kelce‚Äôs newfound Swiftie status. And Eagle wasn‚Äôt the only one, with NFL Network‚Äôs Rich Eisen including a slew of lyric references during a preshow, including ‚Äúshake it off‚Äù, ‚Äúanti-hero‚Äù and ‚Äúall too well‚Äù. Kelce even acknowledged the tongue-in-cheek banter, commenting on a montage video of the preshow that Eisen posted to Instagram. ‚ÄúWell played Rich ‚Ä¶ Well played,‚Äù he wrote. Suddenly, football fans and Swifties were living through this surprising collision. Swift lyrics were infiltrating NFL game commentary, and her fans were furiously becoming football experts. All that needed to happen was for Swift herself to infiltrate a game, determining once and for all whether there was anything to these rumours or not. This Is Me Trying

On September 21, Kelce announced on The Pat McAfee Show he had invited Swift to watch one of his games. ‚ÄúI told her, ‚ÄòI‚Äôve seen you rock the stage in Arrowhead, you might have to come see me rock a stage at Arrowhead and we can see which one‚Äôs a little more lit,‚Äô‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll see what happens in the near future.‚Äù Were they finally about to hard-launch their friendship/potential romance to the world, laying all speculation to rest? Love Story This finally brings us to the fated sighting of Swift at Arrowhead Stadium on Monday, cheering on No. 87 with gusto.

The 12-time Grammy winner appeared to shout ‚Äúlet‚Äôs f‚Äîing go‚Äù after Kelce scored a touchdown before chest-bumping other Chiefs fans. Considering Swift is known for being an Eagles fan ‚Äì she‚Äôs originally from Pennsylvania and even references the team in Gold Rush ‚Äì her outward support for the Kelce‚Äôs team seemed extra telling. Swifties were immediately on high alert, with some capturing Swift and Kelce leaving the stadium together. If that wasn‚Äôt enough, extra observant fans were able to note that Kelce‚Äôs blue and white post-game outfit was supposedly labelled the ‚Äú1989 bedroom painting set‚Äù, perhaps an intentional reference to Swift‚Äôs 2014 album, which she will be re-releasing in October. Swift‚Äôs penchant for Easter eggs must be rubbing off on the tight end player. As if this weren‚Äôt enough subtle references already, they were also spotted in a ‚Äúgetaway car‚Äù together outside the stadium ‚Äì potentially a nod towards her 2017 track. Could they have been driving off into the sunset? Of course, none of this actually confirms Swift and Kelce are actually dating. But regardless of whether it‚Äôs a friendship or a romantic relationship, it has sent shockwaves through two massive cultural franchises, expanding the NFL‚Äôs audience into uncharted territory. It‚Äôs a cultural pairing on par with ‚Äì and perhaps even bigger than ‚Äì Kim Kardashian and Kanye West.
title: When pop culture and sport collide: A timeline of Taylor Swift‚Äôs NFL takeover

Travis Kelce has hilariously confessed that he attempted to delete some of his tweets before they went viral.

The 34-year-old football star spoke candidly about his previous posts on X - formerly known as Twitter - during an episode of his New Heights podcast with brother Jason Kelce, which aired on 22 November. The comments came after some of Kelce‚Äôs funny tweets from 2010 and 2011 resurfaced amid his rumoured relationship with Taylor Swift.

When Jason quipped that everyone is ‚Äúa big fan of college Travis on Twitter‚Äù, the Kansas City Chiefs star acknowledged that his posts weren‚Äôt really noticed back then. However, Kelce explained that he was trying to remove his tweets from social media even before they went viral.

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs hilarious is that nobody followed me back then,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut I will say I have been trying to get all those tweets deleted. Like since I got into the league, I‚Äôm like: ‚ÄòGosh, I just want all those things to get deleted.‚Äô‚Äù

He poked fun at how his tweets are now being mocked, adding: ‚ÄúAnd sure enough, it came surface-level and everybody f***ing dove in, in 2011. What a f***ing year that was.‚Äù

The Philadelphia Eagles star continued to discuss the viral responses to his brother‚Äôs tweets. He even referenced how Jimmy Fallon and his band performed a song, titled ‚ÄúThe Ballad of Travis Kelce‚Äù, on The Tonight Show - in which the late-night host recited Kelce‚Äôs old tweets. The two brothers highlighted the now fan-favourite post, which reads: ‚ÄúI just gave a squirle a piece of bread and it straight smashed all of it!!!! I had no idea they ate bread like that!! Haha #crazy.‚Äù

Kelce later revealed the meanings behind some of his viral tweets, noting that he would simply share the remarks for fun. ‚ÄúI was just using Twitter like a diary. I‚Äôm just out here saying nonsense - ‚ÄòI just gave a squirrel a piece of bread‚Äô - and spelled squirrel like a jacka**,‚Äù Kelce said.

Jason mocked his brother for his spelling of ‚Äúsquirrel‚Äù in the tweet, before claiming that‚Äôs the reason why the post went viral in the first place. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm only spelling squirrel like that from now on, I don‚Äôt know why it‚Äôs spelled the other way,‚Äù he joked. ‚ÄúThis one gets crushed, but I think the only reason it‚Äôs getting crushed is because of the spelling. Outside of that, if I‚Äôm throwing bread around and a squirrel is eating it I‚Äôd be pretty pumped up.‚Äù

Earlier this month, fans of the A-list couple took to X to share screenshots of some of Kelce‚Äôs old tweets - including one post from 2010 that reads: ‚Äú#Chipotle will always be a great choice!!!!‚Äù

The NFL player‚Äôs tweets have unsurprisingly resurfaced amid his relationship with Swift, who he‚Äôs been romantically linked to since the summer. The dating speculation first began in July, when Kelce confessed that he tried and failed to give Swift a friendship bracelet with his number on it during her Eras Tour show. On his podcast, he later invited the ‚ÄúAnti-Hero‚Äù singer to one of his games at Arrowhead Stadium - an invitation she famously accepted on 24 September. Since then, Swift has attended three more of Kelce‚Äôs games.

Kelce showed his support for Swift when he attended her Eras Tour show in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on 11 November. During the concert, Swift gave a shout-out to the Chiefs player when she changed her ‚ÄúKarma‚Äù lyrics to reflect their relationship. ‚ÄúKarma is the guy on the Chiefs, coming straight home to me,‚Äù she sang, letting out a laugh as fans in the audience screamed in response. The ‚ÄúAll Too Well‚Äù singer was later seen running into his arms and kissing the NFL player following the concert, as he whisked her away backstage.

In an interview withWSJ Magazine published on 20 November, Kelce described how much he admires Swift‚Äôs skills as a musician. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never been a man of words. Being around her, seeing how smart Taylor is, has been f***ing mind-blowing. I‚Äôm learning every day,‚Äù he explained.

Although he acknowledged the public attention his personal life has received because he‚Äôs ‚Äúnever dated anyone with that kind of aura around them,‚Äù Kelce specified that he‚Äôs not letting the media affect his relationship.

‚ÄúBut at the same time, I‚Äôm not running away from any of it,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe scrutiny she gets, how much she has a magnifying glass on her, every single day, paparazzi outside her house, outside every restaurant she goes to, after every flight she gets off, and she‚Äôs just living, enjoying life.

‚ÄúWhen she acts like that I better not be the one acting all strange.‚Äù
title: Travis Kelce says he tried to delete his ‚Äònonsense‚Äô tweets before they went viral

Taylor Swift has officially been named Time‚Äôs 2023 Person of the Year.

On Wednesday 6 December, the magazine announced Swift had earned the honour after an ‚Äúeditors‚Äô assessment of the individual who most shaped the headlines over the previous 12 months, for better or for worse‚Äù.

The recognition of Swift comes on the heels of a whirlwind year for the popstar, whose Eras Tour dominated ticket sales in 2023. ‚ÄúThis is the proudest and happiest I‚Äôve ever felt, and the most creatively fulfilled and free I‚Äôve ever been,‚Äù Swift told Time. ‚ÄúUltimately, we can convolute it all we want, or try to overcomplicate it, but there‚Äôs only one question... Are you not entertained?‚Äù

Swift was chosen among a strong list of contenders, including Chinese President Xi Jinping, King Charles III, the live-action Barbie movie, and Vladimir Putin. ‚ÄúWhile her popularity has grown across the decades, this is the year that Swift, 33, achieved a kind of nuclear fusion: shooting art and commerce together to release an energy of historic force,‚Äù the magazine said about its selection.

This year alone, Swift has broken records with her career-spanning Eras Tour, which is estimated to have grossed over $1.4bn. Her concert film, the Eras Tour movie, has surpassed $250m at the global box office since its opening weekend in October. Not to mention her rumoured relationship with Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce caused a 400 per cent spike in NFL jersey sales.

Since her first NFL appearance in September, Swift‚Äôs occasional attendance at Kelce‚Äôs games has received pushback from NFL fans who believe her presence is distracting from the game itself. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just there to support Travis,‚Äù Swift admitted. ‚ÄúI have no awareness of if I‚Äôm being shown too much and pissing off a few dads, Brads, and Chads.‚Äù

She playfully added: ‚ÄúFootball is awesome, it turns out. I‚Äôve been missing out my whole life.‚Äù

The ‚ÄúBad Blood‚Äù singer revealed that their romance began when Kelce gave her shoutout on his podcast, admitting he attempted to give Swift his phone number after one of her Eras Tour shows. The pair immediately began ‚Äúhanging out‚Äù and by the time she attended her first Chiefs game in September, they were already a couple. ‚ÄúI think some people think that they saw our first date at that game? We would never be psychotic enough to hard launch a first date,‚Äù Swift joked.

Back in April, it was revealed that Swift and British actor Joe Alwyn had broken up after six years of dating. The former couple were notoriously private, as the Conversations with Friends star previously expressed he didn‚Äôt want to discuss their relationship because it ‚Äúfeeds into a weird part of the culture‚Äù.

Now, Swift has shared that she has nothing to hide in her new relationship with Kelce. ‚ÄúWhen you say a relationship is public, that means I‚Äôm going to see him do what he loves, we‚Äôre showing up for each other, other people are there and we don‚Äôt care,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThe opposite of that is you have to go to an extreme amount of effort to make sure no one knows that you‚Äôre seeing someone. And we‚Äôre just proud of each other.‚Äù

Speaking to Time, Swift detailed exactly how much work went into preparing for her Eras Tour - where each concert spans over 180 minutes, with more than 40 songs from at least nine albums and 16 costume changes. ‚ÄúEvery day I would run on the treadmill, singing the entire set list out loud,‚Äù she told the outlet. ‚ÄúFast for fast songs, and a jog or a fast walk for slow songs.‚Äù

She also stopped drinking and underwent three months of dance training, something that she admitted is ‚Äúnot my strong suit‚Äù. After she plays a run of shows, Swift said she takes a day to rest and recover before taking the stage once again. ‚ÄúI do not leave my bed except to get food and take it back to my bed and eat it there,‚Äù she revealed. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a dream scenario.‚Äù

Most recently, a heat wave in Brazil forced Swift to postpone the second night of her Eras Tour shows in Rio de Janeiro. The decision came after one of the singer‚Äôs fans, 23-year-old Ana Clara Benevides, died from a cardiac arrest during Swift‚Äôs first performance in the country. Swift explained to Time that ‚Äúpart of my identity as a human‚Äù is putting on a show for her fans, no matter the circumstances. ‚ÄúI know I‚Äôm going on that stage whether I‚Äôm sick, injured, heartbroken, uncomfortable, or stressed,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs part of my identity as a human being now. If someone buys a ticket to my show, I‚Äôm going to play it unless we have some sort of force majeure.‚Äù

Perhaps it was her decision to re-record her music catalogue that catapulted Swift into such success. When music mogul Scooter Braun aquired Swift‚Äôs longtime label, Big Machine Records, in 2019, he also gained the rights to the master recordings of Swift‚Äôs first six studio albums. In November 2020, Braun sold the masters to an investment fund in a deal that was believed to be over $300 million. Since then, Swift has released four ‚ÄúTaylor‚Äôs Version‚Äù albums: Fearless (Taylor‚Äôs Version) in April 2021, Red (Taylor‚Äôs Version) in November 2021, Speak Now (Taylor‚Äôs Version) in July 2023, and 1989 (Taylor‚Äôs Version) in October 2023.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not lost on me that the two great catalysts for this happening were two horrendous things that happened to me,‚Äù Swift said, when asked about the success of her tour. ‚ÄúThe first was getting cancelled within an inch of my life and sanity. The second was having my life‚Äôs work taken away from me by someone who hates me.‚Äù

While Swift is arguably more famous now than ever before, the Grammy winner revealed that the constant attention and swarms of paparazzi won‚Äôt stop her from living her life. There‚Äôs also constant rumours surrounding her personal life, specifically rumours about her relationship with Alwyn that her publicist, Tree Paine, was forced to publicly deny.

‚ÄúOver the years, I‚Äôve learned I don‚Äôt have the time or bandwidth to get pressed about things that don‚Äôt matter,‚Äù Swift told Time. ‚ÄúYes, if I go out to dinner, there‚Äôs going to be a whole chaotic situation outside the restaurant. But I still want to go to dinner with my friends.

‚ÄúLife is short. Have adventures. Me locking myself away in my house for a lot of years - I‚Äôll never get that time back,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm more trusting now than I was six years ago.‚Äù
title: Taylor Swift is Time‚Äôs Person of the Year

In her forthcoming memoir, The Woman in Me, Britney Spears is expected to reflect on some of the most pivotal moments in her life, including her relationships.

Over the years, the pop star‚Äôs love life has continued to make headlines. Most recently, her ex-husband Sam Asghari filed for divorce after only 14 months of marriage. Spears is also the mother of two children ‚Äì Sean, 18, and Jayden, 17 ‚Äì who she shares with her second ex-husband, Kevin Federline.

According to a press release for The Woman in Me, Spears‚Äô memoir is ‚Äúa brave and astonishingly moving story about freedom, fame, motherhood, survival, faith, and hope‚Äù. Spears‚Äô book is also expected to cover the high-profile legal battle to end her conservatorship, which was dissolved in November 2021 after 13 years.

Throughout her time in the spotlight, specifically during the ‚Äò90s and 2000s, Spears has been in some heavily publicised romances. Unsurprisingly, fans are anticipating that Spears will detail some of her relationships in The Woman in Me, which is set for release on 24 October.

From Justin Timberlake to her now ex-husband Sam Asghari, here‚Äôs everything we know about Britney Spears‚Äô relationships and rumoured romances.

Justin Timberlake: 1998 to 2002

(Getty Images)

Spears‚Äô first highly public relationship was with her co-star in the Mickey Mouse Club, Justin Timberlake. The pair made many appearances together while dating, including the iconic moment Spears and Timberlake wore matching, all-denim outfits to the American Music Awards in 2001.

They broke up in 2002, shortly after Timberlake and his boy band NSYNC released their hit tune, ‚ÄúCry Me a River‚Äù. At the time, the music video for the song ‚Äì which featured a woman with blonde hair - sparked rumours that he and Spears broke up because she allegedly cheated on him.

Although the former couple never acknowledged the breakup rumours, the 2021 Framing Britney documentary addressed some of the public scrutiny that Spears faced during the 2000s. Following the documentary‚Äôs release, Timberlake came under criticism for the way he acted following his breakup with Spears.

He later issued an apology to Spears on Instagram, writing: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen the messages, tags, comments, and concerns and I want to respond. I am deeply sorry for the times in my life where my actions contributed to the problem, where I spoke out of turn, or did not speak up for what was right. I understand that I fell short in these moments and in many others and benefited from a system that condones misogyny and racism.‚Äù

In June 2021, he also shared his support for Spears after she testified publicly in a bid to end her conservatorship, which was controlled by her father, Jamie Spears. In a Los Angeles court hearing at the time, Spears alleged that she had been forced to take lithium against her will. She also claimed that the team managing her conservatorship had prevented her from having another baby by refusing to remove her IUD.

‚ÄúAfter what we saw today, we should all be supporting Britney at this time. Regardless of our past, good and bad, and no matter how long ago it was,‚Äù Timberlake wrote on X, formerly known as Twitter. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs happening to her is just not right. No woman should ever be restricted from making decisions about her own body.‚Äù

Wade Robson: 2001 to 2002

Shortly after her breakup from Timberlake, Spears was rumoured to be dating Wade Robson, a dancer and choreographer who appeared in the music video for her 2009 tune, ‚Äú(You Drive Me) Crazy‚Äù. However, neither Spears nor Robson confirmed these rumours.

Colin Farrell: 2003

(Getty Images)

Back in 2003, Farrell and Spears made headlines when they were spotted holding hands at the premiere of The Recruit, sparking speculation that they were dating. However, during an interview with Entertainment Tonight at the time, the actor specified that he and the singer were just friends.

‚ÄúShe‚Äôs just a mate,‚Äù Farrell told the outlet, as reported by People in 2003. ‚ÄúSeriously, we just met a week ago, [we‚Äôre] having a laugh.‚Äù

Jason Alexander: 2004

Jason Alexander was Spears‚Äô first husband, tying the knot at a wedding chapel in Las Vegas in 2004. However, only 55 hours after the nuptials, they annulled the marriage.

In 2022, Alexander made headlines when he tried to attend Spears‚Äô wedding to Asghari, as could be heard saying in a video that he was going to crash the nuptials. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs my first wife, my only wife,‚Äù Alexander reportedly told security. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm her first husband, I‚Äôm here to crash the wedding.‚Äù

After he was arrested for trespassing, vandalism, and battery, a security guard later revealed in court that when Alexander crashed the wedding, he also tried to enter Spears‚Äô bedroom.

Kevin Federline: 2004 to 2007

(Getty Images)

Kevin Federline and the ‚ÄúGimme More‚Äù singer first met at a club in 2004, before they went on to start their relationship. After just three months of dating, the two tied the knot in September of that year during a surprise wedding ceremony. Weeks before their one-year wedding anniversary, they welcomed their first child, son Sean Preston.

In 2006, they welcomed their second son, Jayden James. At the time, Federline was already a father to his daughter Kori Madison, now 20, and son Kaleb Michael, 18, with ex-fianc√©e Shar Jackson.

Spears went on to file for divorce from Federline in November 2006, citing ‚Äúirreconcilable differences‚Äù as the reason for their split. In the couple‚Äôs initial divorce settlement, they were granted joint legal and physical custody over their two children. While it appeared they were on good terms after their separation, things took a turn in 2018 when Federline requested an increase of $20,000 a month more child support payments from Spears.

After months of court discussions, Federline rejected Spears‚Äôs child support proposal and instead doubled his request to $40k a month. A settlement was finally reached between the two parties in September 2018, with Spears increasing her child support payments to Federline from $20,000 to $35,000 a month.

Federline has since moved on from the relationship, as he married volleyball player Victoria Prince in 2013. They now share two daughters, Jordan, 10, and Peyton, eight.

Adnan Ghalib: 2007 to 2008

Spears met British paparazzo Adnan Ghalib in 2007, shortly after she decided to shave her hair off in front of approximately 70 photographers. They only dated for about a year, as the relationship ended in 2008.

In the 2021 Netflix documentary, Britney vs Spears, Ghalib spoke candidly about the romance, claiming: ‚ÄúIt was a very simple, very easy relationship, you know? But between her fans and everybody else, it was like I was the bad guy.‚Äù

The former couple split in 2008 after Ghalib reportedly pulled a pregnancy test-buying stunt for publicity. In 2009, Jamie Spears filed a restraining order against Ghalib, which ordered the photographer to stay away from the singer and her family until 2012.

Jason Trawick: 2009 to 2013

(Getty Images)

Spears and Jason Trawick, a Hollywood agent who worked at WME, started dating in 2009 before getting engaged in December 2011. However, they called off their engagement in January 2013 and announced they were going their separate ways.

"Jason and I have decided to call off our engagement. I‚Äôll always adore him and we will remain great friends," Spears said in a statement sent by her representative to ABC News.

Trawick also issued a statement at the time, saying: ‚ÄúAs this chapter ends for us a new one begins. I love and cherish her and her boys and we will be close forever."

David Lucado: 2013 to 2014

Two months after ending her engagement with Trawick, Spears started dating David Lucado, who worked at a legal firm. In August 2014, Spears announced their split, tweeting: ‚ÄúAhhhh the single life!‚Äù At the time, her representative also confirmed to People: ‚ÄúYes, she‚Äôs single.‚Äù

The news of the breakup came asTMZ alleged that Lucado had cheated on Spears, with claims that her father had purchased a video of the infidelity incident. The publication later alleged that Lucado denied the cheating allegations, with claims that he was seeing the other woman while he and Spears were broken up.

Despite their seemingly rocky history, Lucado showed his support for his ex in a 2016 interview with theNew York Times about her conservatorship. Speaking to the publication, he said: ‚ÄúIf anyone knew the real Britney, they would know that she would rather be remembered for being the great mother she is rather than the artist she is.‚Äù

The publication also noted that Lucado denied the infidelity claims from Spears‚Äô father, before he added: ‚ÄúAnd if anyone could see her interactions with her kids, they would know that there is no need for a conservatorship over Britney‚Äôs personal life.‚Äù

Charlie Ebersol: 2014 to 2015

Spears and Charlie Ebersol, who is known as the co-founder of Tempus Ex Machina and The Company, started dating in 2014. While their relationship was fairly low profile, Spears previously opened up about why she was drawn to Ebersol in the first place.

‚ÄúThere was something about him that made me feel really peaceful and at ease. And he was really hot, too. Adorably hot,‚Äù she told People at the time.

They officially broke up in June 2015 after eight months of dating.

Sam Asghari: 2016 to 2023

(Getty Images)

The pair first met in 2016 when Asghari was cast as Spears‚Äô love interest in the music video for her song, ‚ÄúSlumber Party‚Äù, from her 2016 album Glory. They made their relationship Instagram official in 2017 and went on to support each other through different milestones - including the 29th annual GLAAD Media Awards, where Spears accepted the Vanguard Award for her work promoting equality and acceptance.

In April 2022, Spears announced she was pregnant with her and Asghari‚Äôs first child together, and her third child. However, the following month, she said in a statement posted to Instagram that she had suffered a miscarriage. The couple wrote: ‚ÄúWe have lost our miracle baby.‚Äù

That June, they held their lavish nuptials at her home in California with a star-studded guest list, which included Selena Gomez, Paris Hilton, Drew Barrymore, and Donatella Versace - who designed Spears‚Äô wedding dress.

In August, months after Asghari shut down speculation about getting a divorce, TMZ claimed that he had confronted Spears about rumours she cheated on him. That same day, the fitness instructor officially filed for divorce, listing the date of separation as 28 July 2023 and citing "irreconcilable differences" as the reason for the split.

In a statement posted online, Asghari said: ‚ÄúAfter six years of love and commitment to each other my wife and I have decided to end our journey together. We will hold onto the love and respect we have for each other and I wish her the best always. S*** happens. Asking for privacy seems ridiculous so I will just ask for everyone including the media to be kind and thoughtful.‚Äù

Days before Spears‚Äô memoir release date, Asghari revealed that he had obtained an early copy of the book. In an interview with TMZ on 13 October, he explained that he wasn‚Äôt worried about anything being written in the book that could paint him in a negative light.

‚ÄúI already read it and I‚Äôm very proud of her,‚Äù he told the outlet. ‚ÄúShe put a lot of work into it, and it was very hard. I‚Äôm definitely excited, and I‚Äôm extremely proud of her. It was a very tough one [to write].‚Äù

The Woman in Me is due for release on 24 October in the US and UK.
title: From Justin Timberlake to Sam Asghari: A timeline of Britney Spears‚Äô relationships

author: Laura Snapes
body:
She has never really known freedom

As a child, Britney escaped her difficult home life ‚Äì her alcoholic father often rowing with her mother ‚Äì into the outdoors, which ‚Äúgave me a sense of aliveness and danger‚Äù, she writes. Performing also makes her feel invincible. But by the age of 16, she is public property ‚Äì incapable of going outside without being mobbed, and her love of singing and dancing now a lucrative resource.

By the time of her second album, she wants for so little: skinny-dipping with her dancers after playing Rock in Rio in January 2001 is one of her happiest memories. ‚ÄúIt was a taste of rebellion and freedom, but I was just having fun and being a 19-year-old,‚Äù she writes. After her split from Justin Timberlake, she dreams about quitting pop and opening a shop: ‚ÄúWith the gift of hindsight I can see that I hadn‚Äôt given myself enough time to heal from the breakup,‚Äù she writes ‚Äì though her requests for a break are not only turned down, but interpreted as a potential sign of sedition to be quashed and interrogated.

In this restrictive environment, small kindnesses take on an outsized significance, like Paris Hilton encouraging her ‚Äúto have fun for the first time in a long time‚Äù, leading to some infamous nights out with the heiress and Lindsay Lohan. Once again, Britney is seen as stepping out of bounds, potentially damaging her earning potential. One night she has her mother babysit her sons; when she returns home tipsy, Lynne Spears screams at her, she writes. ‚ÄúThe shame I felt killed my heart. I stood there, reeling, and thought, OK, I guess it‚Äôs forbidden for me to party.‚Äù As the restrictions get tighter, Britney acts out ‚Äì and ends up legally denied her freedom for 13 years, under a conservatorship controlled by her father.

Her body felt like public property

From day one, Britney‚Äôs body is made fair game. Between the videos for her debut single, Baby, One More Time and Sometimes, the media noted her changing physique and concluded that the 16-year-old must have had breast implants ‚Äì rather than simply going through puberty. She notices that talkshow hosts ask her about her chest, while her boyfriend Justin Timberlake gets asked serious questions about his music. It‚Äôs one of many pressures that ultimately push her to breaking point, and when she writes about shaving her head in a salon in 2007, she frames it as a ‚Äúfuck you‚Äù to the impossible beauty standards she felt forced to live up to: ‚ÄúI‚Äôd smiled politely while TV show hosts leered at my breasts, while American parents said I was destroying their children by wearing a crop top.‚Äù

That brief moment of freedom doesn‚Äôt last long: a year later, she is ambushed into the conservatorship, which also exercises jurisdiction over her body. ‚ÄúNo matter how much I dieted and exercised, my father was always telling me I was fat,‚Äù she writes. Punishing gym routines leave her feeling ‚Äúout of my mind‚Äù. Her diet is monitored ‚Äì along with every other detail of her life ‚Äì while she goes through the motions of her Las Vegas residency. ‚ÄúMy body was strong enough to carry two children and agile enough to execute every choreographed move perfectly onstage. And now here I was, having every calorie recorded so people could continue to get rich off my body.‚Äù

Here I was, having every calorie recorded so people could continue to get rich off my body

On the other side of the conservatorship, she writes, freedom looks like being able to gain weight without anyone ‚Äúshouting at me‚Äù. It‚Äôs eating chocolate again. It‚Äôs posting selfies ‚Äì either nude or clothed ‚Äì on Instagram. Some people don‚Äôt understand the latter, she writes, ‚Äúbut I think if they‚Äôd been photographed by other people thousands of times, prodded and posed for other people‚Äôs approval, they‚Äôd understand that I get a lot of joy from posing the way I feel sexy and taking my own picture, doing whatever I want with it.‚Äù

Her ‚Äòvirginity‚Äô was a prison

Britney was actively marketed as a virgin, a repulsive, archaic premise that made the 16-year-old‚Äôs inevitable sexuality into a kind of timebomb. In fact, she writes happily, she first slept with her older brother‚Äôs best friend when she was 14. Yet the fixation on her ‚Äúpurity‚Äù took ‚Äúthe focus off me as a musician and a performer‚Äù, she writes. ‚ÄúAll some reporters could think of to ask me was whether or not my breasts were real (they were, actually) and whether or not my hymen was intact.‚Äù

Britney Spears and Justin Timberlake in 2002. Photograph: Tom Mihalek/AFP/Getty Images

When Timberlake tells the world that she cheated on him, she is all but emblazoned with a scarlet letter. While she knows she is powerless against that narrative (‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think Justin realised the power he had in shaming me. I don‚Äôt think he understands to this day‚Äù), him telling the world that they had a sexual relationship was liberating. ‚ÄúTo be honest with you, I liked that Justin said that,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúWhy did my managers work so hard to claim I was some kind of young-girl virgin even into my 20s? Whose business was it if I‚Äôd had sex or not?‚Äù

But she still couldn‚Äôt escape the cycle that Timberlake set in motion: she describes her 2004 Onyx Hotel tour in the aftermath as ‚Äútoo sexual, for a start. Justin had embarrassed me publicly, so my rebuttal onstage was to kind of go there a little bit, too. But it was absolutely horrible.‚Äù

She has an immaculate sense of shade

Britney seems too pure of heart for active malice, but she has an immaculate way with a piercing characterisation. Timberlake‚Äôs band, ‚ÄòNSync, were big hip-hop heads, she writes, and sometimes ‚Äútried too hard to fit in‚Äù with Black artists. When Timberlake spots Ginuwine at an event, he ‚Äúgot all excited and said, so loud, ‚ÄòOh yeah fo shiz, fo shiz! Ginuwiiiine! What‚Äôs up, homie!‚Äô‚Äù

Her account of being encouraged to abort their pregnancy at home, lest anyone see them going in and out of hospital, is horrifying. Britney, with no pain relief, is writhing on the floor. Timberlake proves to be the last person you‚Äôd call in a crisis. ‚ÄúAt some point he thought maybe music would help, so he got his guitar and he lay there with me, strumming it,‚Äù she writes. Almost as embarrassing is husband Kevin Federline‚Äôs attempt to start a music career. ‚ÄúHe really thought he was a rapper now,‚Äù she writes, with the bafflement of someone who has never known pretension. ‚ÄúBless his heart ‚Äì because he did take it so seriously.‚Äù

Motherhood leaves her vulnerable

When Britney gets pregnant with her first son, she initially thinks it might protect her: ‚ÄúI wanted everyone to stay away: stand back! There‚Äôs a baby here!‚Äù Inevitably, it doesn‚Äôt work out that way. The paparazzi become aggressive, particularly once she has her kids in quick succession ‚Äì becoming pregnant a second time three months after giving birth to her first. She suffers from postnatal depression and feels hopeless about her ability to protect her sons: ‚ÄúI got a little depressed once I was no longer keeping them safe inside my body ‚Ä¶ I wanted them back inside me so the world couldn‚Äôt get at them.‚Äù

Every part of normal life had been stripped from me. I had no freedom and yet also no security

She has a keen sense of injustice regarding a perceived contract that she never signed with the public and the press. ‚ÄúThey just kept acting like I owed it to them to let the men who kept trying to catch me looking fat take photos of my infant sons.‚Äù Her postpartum body and shots of her without makeup were treated as ‚Äúsome kind of a sin ‚Äì as if gaining weight was something unkind I‚Äôd done to them personally, a betrayal. At what point did I promise to stay 17 for the rest of my life?‚Äù

What she knows now, she writes, ‚Äúis that every part of normal life had been stripped from me ‚Äì going out in public without becoming a headline, making normal mistakes as a new mother of two babies, feeling like I could trust the people around me. I had no freedom and yet also no security. At the time I was also suffering, I now know, from severe postpartum depression.‚Äù It left her suicidal. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll admit it, I felt that I couldn‚Äôt live if things didn‚Äôt get better.‚Äù

She knows she is trapped in a state of arrested development

It‚Äôs often said that famous people are frozen in time at the age they became famous, but Britney was never allowed to be a real child, nor a real adult. Her 2001 single I‚Äôm Not a Girl, Not Yet a Woman may be her most prescient recording; she is painfully conscious of this divide. After her split from Timberlake, she likens herself to Benjamin Button. ‚ÄúSomehow that year, in becoming more vulnerable I started to feel like a child again.‚Äù

The situation worsens amid postnatal depression. ‚ÄúIt was as if some part of me became the baby,‚Äù she writes in an apologetic section about transferring her frustrations on to her interior decorator. ‚ÄúOne part of me was a very demanding grown woman yelling about white marble, while another part of me was suddenly very childlike.‚Äù

When she is placed under the conservatorship, she not only regresses, but feels dehumanised by the constant scrutiny. ‚ÄúI became a robot. But not just a robot ‚Äì a sort of child-robot. The conservatorship stripped me of my womanhood, made me into a child.‚Äù It‚Äôs hard to explain, she says, ‚Äúhow quickly I could vacillate between being a little girl and being a teenager and being a woman, because of the way they had robbed me of my freedom ‚Ä¶ They wanted me to be wild onstage, the way they told me to be, and to be a robot the rest of the time.‚Äù

Music seems to have become an afterthought

Early on, Britney writes, she loved making music. She told the producer Max Martin that she wanted to sound more R&B than straight pop; she listened to Tainted Love the night before recording Baby, One More Time and stayed up late so that she would sound as gravelly and ‚Äúfried‚Äù as Marc Almond. She was a studio perfectionist who would stay in the booth for hours, and the school setting and uniforms of the Baby video were her idea. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs probably the moment in my life when I had the most passion for music,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúI was unknown and I had nothing to lose if I messed up.‚Äù

After that, her music barely gets a mention in A Woman Like Me. There‚Äôs a nod to her breaking records; the era-defining Toxic is dispensed with in a sentence. The only album that she goes into any kind of detail on is 2007‚Äôs cult favourite Blackout, made at the height of her public struggles yet full of potential. The studio was a refuge from the paparazzi hounding her outside; making a messy DIY video for the single Gimme More may be ‚Äúby far the worst video I‚Äôve ever shot in my life‚Äù, but the scrappiness meant ‚Äúmore interesting people started noticing and wanting to work with me‚Äù. There‚Äôs some later love for 2016‚Äôs Glory, and she writes proudly about her 2022 collaboration with Elton John, but says she has no plans to make music at the moment.

Her life under the conservatorship is a horror story

It feels fitting that The Woman in Me is being released a week before Halloween. No matter how much we already know about the 13 years that Britney lived under a conservatorship, her recounting of its imposition, life under it and her inability to escape it is nothing short of a horror story. It is appalling, like something out of a Victorian novel, not the very real experiences of a thirtysomething in the last decade.

When she fears that Federline is going to take away access to her kids, she locks herself in a bathroom with one of her sons. ‚ÄúBefore I knew what was happening, a Swat team in black suits burst through the bathroom door as if I‚Äôd hurt someone,‚Äù she writes, and she is subject to a forced hospital hold. Soon after, her mother invites her to her beach house because ‚Äúthe cops are after you‚Äù. When she arrives, so does another Swat team. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a five-foot four-inch pop singer who calls everyone sir and ma‚Äôam,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúThey treated me like I was a criminal or predator.‚Äù

The conservatorship clamps down on her life, ruled by her father, who she alleges was ‚Äúan alcoholic, someone who‚Äôd declared bankruptcy, who‚Äôd failed in business, who‚Äôd terrified me as a little girl‚Äù. She is medicated and surveilled. Her dates are required to agree to background checks and blood tests, made to sign NDAs, and receive a full rundown of her sexual history before the first date. ‚ÄúThe insanity of this system kept me from finding basic companionship, having a fun night out or making new friends ‚Äì let alone falling in love,‚Äù Britney writes. ‚ÄúIt was just the worst thing that could possibly ever happen to my music, my career and my sanity.‚Äù

She accedes in order to retain access to her boys, but questions how she can perform at such a high level when she is perceived as ‚Äúso sick that I couldn‚Äôt make my own decisions‚Äù. She makes futile attempts to escape the arrangement; meanwhile her father sends her to rehab and Alcoholics Anonymous because she has been taking over-the-counter energy supplements. The women at AA inspire her to start trying to take control over her life but she just hits more walls. Her father won‚Äôt let her remove her IUD to start a family with her new boyfriend, later husband, Sam Ashgari (they have divorced since Britney completed the memoir). After she objects to a new dance move suggested for her Vegas residency, she is sent to a solitary rehabilitation facility for two months, the most upsetting part of the book.

Was I a bank robber? A wild animal? Why was I treated as though I were about to burn the place down and murder them all?

She is locked up, put on lithium, subject to relentless testing and mandatory therapy, can‚Äôt see her kids or dog, can‚Äôt bathe or dress in private or shut the door to her room, has set bed and waking times. For blood tests, ‚Äúthe tech drawing my blood would be flanked by the nurse, a security guard and my assistant. Was I a cannibal? Was I a bank robber? Was I a wild animal? Why was I treated as though I were about to burn the place down and murder them all?‚Äù She wonders if her family is trying to kill her. Made slow and sclerotic, ‚ÄúI began to feel like I was being ritually tortured,‚Äù she writes, feeling estranged from her own body. ‚ÄúIf the idea of my being in that place was to heal, that was not the effect.‚Äù

She‚Äôs not scared of anything after that experience, she writes, ‚Äúbut it doesn‚Äôt make me feel strong; it makes me sad. I shouldn‚Äôt be this strong.‚Äù

#FreeBritney protesters in 2021. Photograph: √âtienne Laurent/EPA

A nurse shows Britney the blossoming fan movement that is spreading awareness of its suspicions that all is not right with her conservatorship. Come June 2021, she calls 911 to report her father for conservatorship abuse days before a probate court hearing on the arrangement. ‚ÄúMy voice had been used for me and against me so many times that I was afraid nobody would recognise it now if I spoke freely,‚Äù she writes. When she is granted her freedom in November 2021, she says she feels shock, relief, elation, sadness and joy.

There is no love lost for her family

Britney writes about how she was always made to feel she was not enough as a kid; her father‚Äôs alleged alcoholism, neglect and brutal standards; how her mother always made her feel less-than. She is unsparing about her younger sister, who she characterises as a brat who was spared the pain of Britney‚Äôs impoverished childhood because of her success. ‚ÄúMy mom and I had to witness the ugliness and the violence without believing that there was anywhere else to go.‚Äù

Even once Britney is the biggest pop star in the world, her parents still seem to have an undue say in the running of her career, including making her sit for humiliating TV interviews ‚Äì why exactly that is remains unanswered. Her father seizes control legally with the imposition of the conservatorship, telling her, chillingly, ‚ÄúI am Britney Spears now,‚Äù and her family appear to live off her dime while she lives an extraordinarily restricted life.

When she returns home from the forced stint in a brutal rehab facility, she finds that her parents have thrown away her childhood things, including a binder full of her poetry. ‚ÄúI felt an overwhelming sadness. I thought of the pages I‚Äôd written through tears. I never wanted to publish them or anything like that, but they were important to me. And my family had thrown them in the trash, just like they‚Äôd thrown me away.‚Äù She resolves to start over with a new notebook. ‚ÄúIn that moment I made peace with my family,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúBy which I mean that I realised I never wanted to see them again, and I was at peace with that.‚Äù

Britney writes that she is working to feel ‚Äúmore compassion than anger‚Äù towards them. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not easy.‚Äù
title: ‚ÄòI was being ritually tortured‚Äô: the most shocking moments in Britney Spears‚Äô memoir

Will Smith has spoken out about his ‚Äútumultuous‚Äù relationship with his wife, Jada Pinkett Smith, while speaking to a crowd of fans in Baltimore, Maryland.

The 55-year-old actor took the stage at the Enoch Pratt Free Library on 18 October, as he made an appearance at a press event for his wife‚Äôs book, Worthy, alongside their two children ‚Äì Jaden, 25, and Willow, 22. His recent comments come after Jada made major revelations about their marriage in her memoir, including how she and Will have been separated for seven years.

During the event in Baltimore, Will began by speaking to the crowd about his love and admiration for his partner, who he married in 1997. ‚ÄúI just really wanted to come out and just be here and hold it down for you the way you have held it down for me,‚Äù he said during the event, as reported by The Baltimore Sun.

The King Richard star went on to describe the challenges and achievements he‚Äôs had throughout his marriage, adding: ‚ÄúWe have had a very, very long and tumultuous [relationship]. We call it ‚Äòbrutiful.‚Äô It was brutal and beautiful at the same time."

At another point during the event, Will referred to his union with Jada as a ‚Äúsloppy public experiment in unconditional love,‚Äù according to the Baltimore Banner. He went on to explain that he‚Äôs ‚Äúhappier than [he‚Äôs] ever been in [his] entire life‚Äù and praised Jada for continuing to be by his side.

‚ÄúI have achieved every single thing I have ever wanted in my entire life. There is not one thing left that I desire in this world - all of the awards, all of the money, the family - everything I‚Äôve ever dreamed,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd those dreams were largely built on the foundation of Jada‚Äôs sacrifices. There were many times when Jada put her career aside so I could follow the dreams of mine.‚Äù

The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air star thanked his wife for putting him ‚Äúbefore herself‚Äù and for maintaining a good relationship with his ex-wife Sheree Zampino. Will and Zampino share a 30-year-old son, Trey Smith, who was also present for the book event at the Enoch Pratt Free Library. Speaking to the crowd, Will said that Jada‚Äôs positive relationship with Zampino allowed all three of his children the chance to grow up together.

‚ÄúCan you show up and love somebody for the rest of your life, even when you don‚Äôt agree with them?‚Äù he asked. ‚ÄúJada is the best friend I have ever had on this planet and I am going to show up for her and support her for the rest of my life.‚Äù

This isn‚Äôt the first time that Will has opened up about his relationship, as it‚Äôs continued to make headlines. Earlier this week, he appeared to mock the publicity storm surrounding him and Jada in a video titled ‚ÄúOfficial statement‚Äù shared on Instagram. ‚ÄúSo, here‚Äôs the thing. My opinion is... uh‚Ä¶‚Äù the actor said, before sneezing into the crook of his arm. As he sneezed, the video comically zoomed out to show several different landscapes including lakes and mountains.

Prior to sharing the video, Smith showed his support for his partner and her success in a statement toThe New York Times. During the interview, the outlet noted that Smith said his wife‚Äôs memoir ‚Äúkind of woke him up‚Äù and that he has now realised she is more ‚Äúresilient, clever and compassionate than he‚Äôd understood‚Äù.

‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôve been with someone for more than half of your life, a sort of emotional blindness sets in, and you can all too easily lose your sensitivity to their hidden nuances and subtle beauties,‚Äù he added.

In an interview with People published on 10 October, Jada first revealed that she and her husband were living separately. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been doing some really heavy-duty work together,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe just got deep love for each other and we are going to figure out what that looks like for us.‚Äù

However, during an appearance on the Today show on 16 October, Jada clarified to Hoda Kotb that she and the Suicide Squad actor are ‚Äúworking hard‚Äù and are ‚Äúconcentrating on healing‚Äù to get their relationship to a better place.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no finding another great love, and I think that‚Äôs the point,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like we are in a place now that we are in a deep, healing space. And we are really concentrating on healing the relationship between us.‚Äù

The Girls Trip star continued: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no divorce on paper. We really have been working hard. That‚Äôs the whole thing. We are working very hard at bringing our relationship together. Back to a life partnership.‚Äù
title: Will Smith speaks to crowd about ‚Äòtumultuous‚Äô relationship with Jada Pinkett Smith
